sen.j: 院（いん）は、元の意味は高い垣に囲まれた大きな建築物のことで、そこから以下のような意味を表す。
sen.e: In (院) originally meant large architecture surrounded by high walls, and it also refers to the following:
In (院) originally meant a large construction surrounded by high walls, but it also refers to the following:
In (院) originally meant a large construction surrounded by high walls, but it also refers to the following:

sen.j: 太上天皇（上皇）・法皇・女院の称号こと。
sen.e: Title of Daijo Emperor (the retired Emperor), Cloistered Emperor, or Nyo-in (Empress).
The title of the Daijo Emperor (the retired Emperor), the Cloistered Emperor, or the Nyo-in (Empress).
The title of the Daijo Tenno (the Retired Emperor), the Cloistered Emperor, or the Nyo-in (Empress).
sen.cmt: Daijo Tenno, the Retired Emperorとしました。

sen.j: 元は上皇・法皇・女院の御所（邸宅）のことであったが、その人自身をも表すようになった。
sen.e: It originally meant Gosho (Palace) of Joko (the retired Emperor), or Cloistered Emperor, or Nyo-in, and it developed to mean the person who lived there.
It originally meant the Gosho (Palace) of the Joko (retired Emperor), Cloistered Emperor, or Nyo-in, but it developed to mean the person who lived there.
It originally meant the Gosho (Palace) of the Retired Emperor, Cloistered Emperor, or Nyo-in, but it developed to mean the person who lived there.

sen.j: 例えば現在の日本には以下のようなものがある。
sen.e: Examples in Japan are as follows:

sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正し、表記をKaikei kensa-inとしました。

sen.e: Genshiryoku anzen hoan-in (Nuclear and Industrial Safety Agency)
sen.cmt: スペースを入れ、表記をGenshiryoku anzen hoan-inとしました。
スペースを入れ、Kokudo chiri-inとしました。

sen.j: 国会の両議院（衆議院、参議院）
sen.e: Shugi-in (the House of Representative) and Sangi-in (the House of Councilors)
Shugi-in (the House of Representatives) and Sangi-in (the House of Councillors)
Shugi-in (the House of Representatives) and Sangi-in (the House of Councillors)

sen.cmt: ピリオド追加、前出の表記に合わせ、文頭以外の単語の頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 学院、大学院、学習院など。
sen.e: Gaku-in (school), Daigaku-in (graduate school), and Gakushu-in (the Gakushu-in School Corporation)
Gaku-in (institute/academy), Daigaku-in (graduate school), and Gakushu-in (the Gakushu-in School Corporation)
Gaku-in (institute/academy), Daigaku-in (graduate school), and Gakushu-in (the Gakushu-in School Corporation).

sen.j: 産院、養老院、施薬院など。
sen.e: Sanin (maternity hospital), Yoroin (home for old people), and Seyaku-in (free hospital for poor people)
Sanin (maternity hospitals), Yoroin (homes for the elderly), and Seyaku-in (free hospitals for poor people)
Sanin (maternity hospitals), Yoroin (homes for the elderly), and Seyaku-in (free hospitals for poor people).
Or a building in the precincts of a temple
Or a building in the precincts of a temple
Or a building in the precincts of a temple.
Sanzen-in Temple, Byodo-in Temple and so on.
sen.cmt: 「など」を訳出するため一部文章を修正しました。

sen.e: Ingo: posthumous Buddhist name that includes "in"
Ingo: posthumous Buddhist name that includes "in"
Ingo: posthumous Buddhist name that includes "in."

sen.j: 国家機関や学校の名称・病院・医院については、それの略称や造語成分としても使われる（例院内、退院、院長、院生など）。
sen.e: Abbreviated names or derivative words related to government institutions, schools, hospitals, and clinics: Innai (inside a hospital), Taiin (discharge from hospital), Incho (hospital director), and Insei (graduate student).

Abbreviated names or derivative words related to government institutions, schools, hospitals, and clinics: Innai (inside a hospital), Taiin (discharge from hospital), Incho (hospital director), and Insei (graduate student).
